main event: Two bright lights in the sky, stationary and rotating with a color change from white to red. No definite outline or shape.
interesting points: The witness is a retired Navy man with a private pilot's license, and is president of the Dillsboro Flying Club, suggesting he has significant experience observing aircraft.
The witness estimated the speed of the object to be 35 to 40 miles per second, and the distance to be 3 or 4 miles.
The witness reported that the object appeared to be a bright, white light, much brighter than a star, and did not have the appearance of an aircraft.
Three witnesses, two adults and one child, observed the object, and they seemed to be reliable persons.
sighted object: two bright lights in the sky, rotating and changing color
witnesses: three witnesses, two adults and one child
